lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: On a September morning, the air still carried the warmth of summer.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Wearing the long-sleeved autumn uniform, a thin sheen of sweat forms the moment you step outside...

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: As a prospective examinee, today remains just another ordinary day.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: I mounted my beloved bike and headed toward school.

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: You might not tell by looking at me.

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: But I'm actually the captain of Sohoku High's cycling club.

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: The cycling club is the kind of club where we ride bikes every day,

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Whether you're an exam prep student or not.

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: But we just competed in the high school league last month.

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: So we'll be handing over the reins to the next captain soon.

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: The next captain, Onoda, is way stronger than me!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Even though he's a year younger than me,

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: He's won the high school league championship two years in a row!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Compared to him, I'm just an ordinary guy...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: I only joined the league in my senior year...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: And it's only thanks to him that I, as captain, got to stand on the championship podium—

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: The scene at the finish line, the spectators' cheers—it's all still vivid in my mind...

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: It remains the most precious experience of my life—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: After going through the high school league,

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: This steep hill at the back gate feels like nothing now...

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Having given my all in the high school league, I can finally—

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Can "enjoy" pure exam prep life~

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: It's still early.

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Should I head to the clubroom to study for a bit?

options.text: Go study in the club room

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Still got stacks of books to get through.

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Let's go for a ride first—
Teshima—

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Suddenly, I heard someone calling my name...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Isn't that Hirata from the next desk?

lines.speaker: Hirata
lines.text: You haven't forgotten, have you? It's our turn for duty today!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Sorry, sorry~ I totally forgot, heh~

lines.speaker: Hirata
lines.text: Seriously, hurry up already~

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: I quickly parked the car and hurried to catch up with Hirata, walking together toward the classroom...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Let's go study in the club room.
Junta—

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Suddenly, I heard someone calling my name...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Aoyagi? What are you doing here!

lines.speaker: Aoyagi
lines.text: Junta, thanks for the notes.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Aoyagi handed me the English notes he borrowed yesterday.

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: You didn't have to wait for me at the school gate, did you?

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: I could've come find you before class~

lines.speaker: Aoyagi
lines.text: Junta, your first class today is English.

lines.speaker: Aoyagi
lines.text: I didn't want to make you late.

lines.speaker: Aoyagi
lines.text: And—

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Aoyagi glanced at me and gave a slight smile.

lines.speaker: Aoyagi
lines.text: I know Junta should be arriving soon.

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Aoyagi...

lines.speaker: Aoyagi
lines.text: No one knows Junta better than I do.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: A wave of warmth washed over me—

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: This person before me had fought alongside me for three years since our freshman year.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: He was my best partner—

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Our partnership was seamless, our breathing in perfect sync—

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: He is part of my youth—

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Together, we're the ultimate duo!

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: As if reading my mind, Aoyagi responded with unwavering resolve—

lines.speaker: Aoyagi
lines.text: Thank you so much for these past three years, Junta.

lines.speaker: Aoyagi
lines.text: Being able to form T2 with you has been the greatest joy of my life!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: You're exaggerating...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: But seriously, thank you for these past three years, Aoyagi!

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Thinking about it, I suddenly feel so sentimental...

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: After senior year, we might end up at different universities,

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: and won't be able to meet like this often anymore...

lines.speaker: Aoyagi
lines.text: Junta, if you had a time machine, which day would you most want to go back to?

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Why ask that all of a sudden?

options.text: The day I gave up cycling

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: I'd go back to the day I gave up cycling in middle school...

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Aoyagi's expression turned melancholy.

lines.speaker: Aoyagi
lines.text: If I'd known you back then, I would've pulled you back!

lines.speaker: Aoyagi
lines.text: No matter what, I wouldn't let Junta give up cycling—something he loved so much!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: If it had been Aoyagi, always facing himself head-on, who tried to persuade me...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Maybe I really could have...

lines.speaker: Aoyagi
lines.text: Junta...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: I want to go back to the day I met Aoyagi...

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Junta?

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: If we'd formed T2 back then...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: We might have been able to enter the high school league a year earlier...

lines.speaker: Aoyagi
lines.text: Junta...

lines.speaker: Aoyagi
lines.text: Junta really is a cycling fool...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: I'm not!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: I guess I'd most want to go back to yesterday...

lines.speaker: Aoyagi
lines.text: Junta?

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: I bombed the mock exam, so no allowance next month...

lines.speaker: Aoyagi
lines.text: Junta...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: But—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: It just means I have no regrets about the path I've walked so far~

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Especially since I met you, Aoyagi—

lines.speaker: Aoyagi
lines.text: Junta!

lines.speaker: Aoyagi
lines.text: So guess which day I most want to go back to?

options.text: The day of T2's first victory
The day we lost to Onoda

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: The day of T2's first victory?

lines.speaker: Aoyagi
lines.text: If only I'd let Junta cross the finish line first that day,

lines.speaker: Aoyagi
lines.text: like in the high school tournament...

lines.speaker: Aoyagi
lines.text: Then everyone would've realized sooner just how amazing Junta really is!

lines.speaker: Aoyagi
lines.text: I've been right beside Junta all along, so I know better than anyone!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Aoyagi...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: The day we lost to Onoda and the others?

lines.speaker: Aoyagi
lines.text: That day, we lost because I was too weak. Junta's tactics were flawless...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Aoyagi...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: My tactics had plenty of flaws too... And—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Without you, Aoyagi, I wouldn't even have the strength to sprint alongside them...

lines.speaker: Aoyagi
lines.text: Junta...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Could it be yesterday too?

lines.speaker: Aoyagi
lines.text: Junta...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: What? Did you bomb the exam too?

lines.speaker: Aoyagi
lines.text: No...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: No matter what time we want to go back to,

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Forming T2 sooner is always better...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: If only I'd met Aoyagi sooner~

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: If I'd met Aoyagi back in middle school,

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: I might not have given up cycling...

lines.speaker: Aoyagi
lines.text: Junta...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: We might've even made it onto the prefectural team together~

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Because T2 is so strong! We work together so well!

lines.speaker: Aoyagi
lines.text: Junta—

lines.speaker: Aoyagi
lines.text: No matter when we meet, we'll form T2. Is that what you believe, Junta?

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Exactly!

lines.speaker: Aoyagi
lines.text: So Junta, there's nothing to worry about—

lines.speaker: Aoyagi
lines.text: As long as we keep riding, we'll meet like this sooner or later,

lines.speaker: Aoyagi
lines.text: Whether now or in the future—

lines.speaker: Aoyagi
lines.text: Even if we go to different universities, as long as we keep riding,

lines.speaker: Aoyagi
lines.text: T2 will always be T2!

lines.speaker: Aoyagi
lines.text: Because I believe that too!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Aoyagi...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Honestly, I feel like crying first thing in the morning!

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Aoyagi smiled happily—

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Whoever said he was quiet and reserved—

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Now he even knows how to read my mood!

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: I smiled back at him too—

lines.speaker: Aoyagi
lines.text: Junta, you mentioned yesterday that it was your turn for duty today—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Oh no! I completely forgot!

lines.speaker: Aoyagi
lines.text: I'll park the car for you, go ahead~

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Thanks~ Good partner~

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: I hurriedly handed the car over to Aoyagi and sped off toward the classroom—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Phew... Finally, class is over...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Mr. Sato's class is just so tediously long...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Let's grab lunch quickly—we've got PE this afternoon.

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: I Didn't bring lunch today,

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: So I'd like to eat at the cafeteria~
???: Teshima—

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Suddenly, I heard someone calling my name—

lines.speaker: Hirata
lines.text: Going to the cafeteria? Let's go together~

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: You didn't bring lunch today?

lines.speaker: Hirata
lines.text: Just finished the mock exam, I got a bit too relaxed and overslept this morning...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Haha, me too~

lines.speaker: Hirata
lines.text: Anyway, I still have some allowance left from the beginning of the month.

lines.speaker: Hirata
lines.text: Might as well splurge today—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Oh, shrimp tempura udon?

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: I'm craving that too~

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Hirata and I chatted and laughed as we headed toward the cafeteria—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: I brought lunch today. I'd like to eat in the club room—
???: AAAAAHHHHHHHHHH!!!!!
???: So cool!!!!!

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Suddenly, I heard a flurry of excitement from the girls...

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Curious, I looked toward the source of the noise—

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Our cycling club's second-year ace completely surrounded by third-year girls!

lines.speaker: Imaizumi
lines.text: Teshima-senpai!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Oh, it's Imaizumi—

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: After greeting him, I was about to turn and leave...

lines.speaker: Imaizumi
lines.text: Senpai, please save me—

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: I had no choice but to pull him out from the crowd of girls.

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Why are you here at the third-year building instead of eating lunch?

lines.speaker: Imaizumi
lines.text: Imaizumi stared at me without a word—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Isn't Takahashi the butler preparing a feast?

lines.speaker: Imaizumi
lines.text: I'm alone today, so I'll just grab something at the cafeteria...

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: So he really does prepare meals in advance, huh~

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: You're an elite student.

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Won't eating at the commoners' cafeteria upset your stomach?

lines.speaker: Imaizumi
lines.text: Senpai, why don't you come with me?

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: I brought my lunch. I'll eat in the club room~

lines.speaker: Imaizumi
lines.text: Doesn't it matter where you eat?!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Don't look down on people, elite!

lines.speaker: Imaizumi
lines.text: I'll treat you!!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: You're such a big shot~ So generous!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: I'll go with you~

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Imaizumi and I arrived at the cafeteria, which wasn't as crowded as I'd imagined.

lines.speaker: Imaizumi
lines.text: Teshima-senpai, you pick one—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: On a day this hot, cold noodles are definitely the way to go.

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Which one should I pick?

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: I'll have the plain udon~

lines.speaker: Imaizumi
lines.text: Exam candidates should eat nutritious food!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Well, if you put it that way, I won't hesitate~

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: I'll have the fried tofu udon~

lines.speaker: Imaizumi
lines.text: Exam candidates should eat nutritious food!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Well, if you put it that way, I won't hold back~

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Since you're treating, I won't hold back—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: I'll have the tempura udon with a fried egg on top~

lines.speaker: Imaizumi
lines.text: Got it—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Just kidding! Don't agree so quickly!

lines.speaker: Imaizumi
lines.text: Why not?

lines.speaker: Imaizumi
lines.text: Exam candidates should eat something nutritious.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: The chef rinsed the freshly boiled udon noodles under cold water.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Afterwards, he placed them into a bowl of light brown broth.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: After sprinkling a generous handful of chopped green onions,

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: He added the sizzling, oil-dripping tempura to the bowl—

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: And he didn't forget to top it off with a perfectly fried soft-boiled egg!

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: A mouthwatering, perfect combination!

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: I happily took the tray with the udon,

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: And glancd at Imaizumi beside me who seemed unsure how to order...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Which one are you having?

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Imaizumi gazed longingly at the bento in my hands—

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Slurp slurp—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: So delicious!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: This is the best thing our cafeteria serves!

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Ah!

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: I was so busy slurping noodles I almost forgot that right now.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Imaizumi is staring at my humble bento, completely at a loss!

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Imaizumi holds his chopsticks...

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: He stared at the simple lunchbox before him—one I know all too well...

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: It’s just plain white rice, full of carbs.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: A sprinkle of seasoning goes on top.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: The sides? Broccoli, a rolled omelet, pickled radish, and some tiny sausages.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Since I woke up late,

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: I didn’t have time to cut the sausages into octopus shapes…

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: You don't have to eat it if you don't want to?

lines.speaker: Imaizumi
lines.text: No, no, it's just that this is such a rare treat.

lines.speaker: Imaizumi
lines.text: I can't bring myself to eat it...

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Imaizumi finally picked up a piece of rolled omelet,

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: And popped it into his mouth...

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Seeing he didn't frown,

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: It must mean the taste is still acceptable to him?

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: I woke up late today so it's a bit rushed.

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Next time tell me ahead of time so I can prepare...

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Imaizumi looked overjoyed, which made me feel really good~

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: But you have to tell me ahead of time.

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: I'm starting cram school soon and won't be coming to school often.

lines.speaker: Imaizumi
lines.text: If you do come to school, stop by the cycling club too...

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: My heart skipped a beat—

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: What the heck?

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Even though he talks big, he's still such a cute little junior!

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: I tried my best not to look too thrilled~

options.text: I'm preparing for exams, I have no time
Are you worried I'll get rusty at cycling?

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: But I'm an exam prep student.

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: I don't have that kind of time.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Imaizumi looked a bit downcast.

lines.speaker: Imaizumi
lines.text: But shouldn't you exercise occasionally?

lines.speaker: Imaizumi
lines.text: Exercise improves memory?

lines.speaker: Imaizumi
lines.text: And...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Alright, alright, I'll go~

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: What, worried I've gotten rusty on the bike?

lines.speaker: Imaizumi
lines.text: No, I know studying for the exam is more important right now, but—

lines.speaker: Imaizumi
lines.text: It's... it's just that Onoda and Naruko really miss you, Senpai!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Hmm, for my adorable juniors~ I'll try my best to make it~

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Imaizumi's face lit up with a happy expression.

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: What, missed me?

lines.speaker: Imaizumi
lines.text: Y-Yes, I wanted to make sure you don't get rusty!!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Elite students really don't cut you any slack~

lines.speaker: Imaizumi
lines.text: And I... I wanted to ride bikes with you... (whispering)

lines.speaker: Imaizumi
lines.text: Anyway, you should drop by the department every once in a while!

lines.speaker: Imaizumi
lines.text: Onoda and Naruko really miss you...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Hmm, for my adorable juniors~ I'll try to make it~

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Imaizumi's face lit up with a happy expression.

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: What about you?

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Don't you miss me at all?

lines.speaker: Imaizumi
lines.text: Ah, no, well, I—

lines.speaker: Imaizumi
lines.text: I... I do think about you sometimes...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Like when?

lines.speaker: Imaizumi
lines.text: When I'm riding my bike... I kinda... habitually look back...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: You think I ride too slow?

lines.speaker: Imaizumi
lines.text: No, no, that's not it—

lines.speaker: Imaizumi
lines.text: When we practice together usually, I can always hear you pedaling hard.

lines.speaker: Imaizumi
lines.text: Lately, I haven't been able to hear it...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Hey! You're just saying I'm out of shape in a roundabout way, aren't you!?

lines.speaker: Imaizumi
lines.text: No, no, I mean... that sound reassured me you were still pushing to keep up—

lines.speaker: Imaizumi
lines.text: It made me feel reassured...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: ...Haha, that's rare!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: An elite actually saying something like that~

lines.speaker: Imaizumi
lines.text: So sometimes I look back to check...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Hahahahaha~

lines.speaker: Imaizumi
lines.text: Please, don't laugh! I'm just stating the facts!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: If you put it that way, I'll ride with you more often from now on~

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: So you can feel reassured~

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: After all, the ace's condition is crucial~

lines.speaker: Imaizumi
lines.text: ...Yes!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: You guys better go easy on me when the time comes~

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: I'm a student preparing for exams, after all~

lines.speaker: Imaizumi
lines.text: If you slack off on your bike training, Senpai, I won't forgive you!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: That's why elites are @q~￥uzvx@!^uz.~￥@vx!...

lines.speaker: Imaizumi
lines.text: If I go easy on you, Senpai will get mad later too...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Exactly, hahaha~

lines.speaker: Imaizumi
lines.text: The bento was delicious. I'll wash it and give it back tomorrow—

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: I wonder if Imaizumi will stuff it full of fancy pastries before returning it tomorrow?

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: I'm kinda looking forward to it~
Tejima, we're heading over first—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Alright~

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: The first class in the afternoon was PE.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: I was hoping to get to the field early to warm up...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: I accidentally left my sports jacket in the club room last week...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: I'd better go get it back—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: This is too much trouble.

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: I'll just borrow one from the class next door~
Teshima—

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Suddenly, I heard someone calling my name—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Higashito~ Perfect timing!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Your class doesn't have PE this week, right?

lines.speaker: Higashito
lines.text: Nope. Did you forget your gear?

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Yeah, I left it in the club room. Too lazy to go get it.

lines.speaker: Higashito
lines.text: Here—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Thanks, I'll give it back to you after I wash it~

lines.speaker: Higashito
lines.text: Don't be so formal with me!

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: I took the clothes and hurried toward the playground—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: I guess I'll head to the club room after all...
Teshima—

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Suddenly, I heard someone calling my name—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Koga? What are you doing here?

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: I saw Koga holding a sports jacket.

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: No way! Your shoulders are too broad—this won't fit me!

lines.speaker: Koga
lines.text: This is your jacket! You curly-haired idiot—

lines.speaker: Koga
lines.text: I saw some idiot left their jacket behind in the club room at lunch, so I grabbed it.

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Perfect timing, thanks a bunch~

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: With Koga running errands for me, I've got plenty of time now~

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Yesss—

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: I slowly slipped off my shirt, revealing the T-shirt underneath—

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: I slipped on my sweatshirt, neatly folded the shirt, and tucked it into the drawer—

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: I closed all the books and notebooks on the desk—

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Sat back down and opened my flip phone—

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Koga beside me finally couldn't take it anymore!

lines.speaker: Koga
lines.text: Get your ass to class already!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: There's still time!

lines.speaker: Koga
lines.text: Don't you have anything to worry about?

lines.speaker: Koga
lines.text: Instead of wasting time on your phone, read more books!

lines.speaker: Koga
lines.text: The classical Chinese exam is on Friday—have you finished reviewing?

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Koga Koga~

lines.speaker: Koga
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: You're really good at classical Chinese, right?

lines.speaker: Koga
lines.text: What do you want?

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Can I borrow your notes to copy?

lines.speaker: Koga
lines.text: No way!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: You're so stingy!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Koga, you're just like my mom!

lines.speaker: Koga
lines.text: I don't have a kid as dumb as you!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: You're going to make yourself unpopular like this—

lines.speaker: Koga
lines.text: Mind your own business!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Scary—Koga-senpai is a sadistic glasses-wearing monster—

lines.speaker: Koga
lines.text: And I'm way more popular with juniors than you are, right?

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Damn it—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Sohoku next year...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Is definitely going to be tougher than this year...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: I feel so bad putting such a heavy burden on Onoda...

lines.speaker: Koga
lines.text: You idiot, curly-top—

lines.speaker: Koga
lines.text: Onoda's way more dependable than you—

lines.speaker: Koga
lines.text: And there are others too—

lines.speaker: Koga
lines.text: All we can do is cheer them on—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: You're right~

lines.speaker: Koga
lines.text: Instead of worrying about them, you should worry about your classical Japanese!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Again?!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Wish the exam was karaoke instead...

lines.speaker: Koga
lines.text: You're so relaxed even though you're studying!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Am I playing around?

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Isn't the group chat buzzing about upcoming college preference interviews?

lines.speaker: Koga
lines.text: Our class already had ours.

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: So which university are you planning to apply to?

lines.speaker: Koga
lines.text: Not sure yet.

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Aren't you still undecided too?

lines.speaker: Koga
lines.text: At least one with a cycling club!

options.text: Not the same school as you!
Is college cycling really that competitive?

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: I don't want to go to the same school as you...

lines.speaker: Koga
lines.text: Why not?

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Just thinking about competing with you for a spot gives me major pressure...

lines.speaker: Koga
lines.text: Seems like you know your limits~

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: You devil glasses!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Is the cycling competition at university super intense...?

lines.speaker: Koga
lines.text: That's exactly why you can't slack off—

lines.speaker: Koga
lines.text: You're Sohoku's weakest rider!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: I... I was worried about your shoulder~

lines.speaker: Koga
lines.text: No need to worry about me.

lines.speaker: Koga
lines.text: It's almost healed already—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Musclehead!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: That's a relief—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Hearing you still want to ride bikes~

lines.speaker: Koga
lines.text: Who'd quit before you, you dumb curly-haired idiot!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Musclehead!

lines.speaker: Koga
lines.text: But I think you can be more confident now.

lines.speaker: Koga
lines.text: Even though you might not beat me on flat ground right now...

lines.speaker: Koga
lines.text: But uphill? You're barely passable.

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: What? Just "barely passable"?

lines.speaker: Koga
lines.text: Even though you didn't get a bib number—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: You're going to say I didn't finish the whole course, aren't you!

lines.speaker: Koga
lines.text: Even though I didn't finish the whole course—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: See! I knew it—

lines.speaker: Koga
lines.text: But compared to the guy who always came in last before, you're like a completely different person now.

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Ugh—I can't take it anymore! You're such a sadistic glasses-wearer!

lines.speaker: Koga
lines.text: I'm genuinely complimenting you, you know?

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: But it still sounds like you're insulting me!

lines.speaker: Koga
lines.text: Anyway, you've gotten stronger. I can guarantee that.

lines.speaker: Koga
lines.text: Because I've been watching you all along—

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Koga seems in a good mood...

lines.speaker: Koga
lines.text: So aren't you going to class?

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Oh no, I'm going to be late!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: It's all your fault for chatting so long!

lines.speaker: Koga
lines.text: Huh? Who was the one messing around on their phone while cleaning up?

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: You Musclehead!

lines.speaker: Koga
lines.text: Stinky curly-haired freak!

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: I quickly ditched Koga and ran toward the playground...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: (Stretching——)

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Finally, all the classes for today are over...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: But the thought of having to go to cram school next...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: This wonderful campus life will soon be over...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: I'm so reluctant to let it go~

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Should I drop by the clubroom?

options.text: Feels like I forgot something important

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: I feel like I'm forgetting something important?
Teshima—

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Suddenly, I heard someone calling my name—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: I figured you'd show up around now...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Hirata~

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Hirata handed me a mop—

lines.speaker: Hirata
lines.text: Don't even think about skipping your duty!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Hahaha, like I would!

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: I chuckled awkwardly. It's true—for a split second, I'd completely forgotten...

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Hirata and I started cleaning nonstop, hoping to slip away early—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Should we drop by the club room?
Teshima~

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Suddenly, I heard someone calling my name—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Higashito?

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: I saw Higashito dragging a massive figure over...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Ashikiba?!!

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: Junta—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: What are you doing here?

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Don't you have class today?

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: Third-year students in the Box Studies program can choose when to come to school...

lines.speaker: Higashito
lines.text: This guy was hanging around the school gate, asking everyone if they knew you.

lines.speaker: Higashito
lines.text: So I brought him over~

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: Thank goodness I ran into Machida-kun~

lines.speaker: Higashito
lines.text: My name's Higashito... Ah, never mind. You two chat. I'm heading home—

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Higashito waved goodbye and headed toward the school gate.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: I took Ashikiba to the school courtyard.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: I picked a bench for us to sit together.

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: It's been a while since you came back to Chiba, hasn't it?

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: You haven't been back since ninth grade, have you?

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: Pretty much...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Do you have a place to stay?

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: Yeah, I can stay with relatives...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Then you can stay a couple extra days this time.

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Your old classmates all say they miss you~

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: Really?

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: You're just so memorable, everyone remembers you!

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: What about you? Do you still remember me?

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Of course!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: We used to ride bikes together every day back then~

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: Junta still wants to conquer the world, right?

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Don't even bring that up—it's so embarrassing—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: He even said he'd quit riding, but ended up getting back on the bike...

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: But I always believed—

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: I believed that as long as I kept riding.

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: I'd definitely meet you again!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Heh heh, didn't expect you to be right about that~

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: Because you're a total bike nerd, right?

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Huh? Who said that—

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: Machida said it—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: What nonsense is that guy Higashito spouting?!

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: It's thanks to cycling that I got to meet you again...

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: I've actually been wanting to apologize to you...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Why?

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: Leaving without a word back then must have really troubled you, right?

options.text: Thought you went back to home planet

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Don't worry about it~

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: We're meeting again now, aren't we?

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: And we're both still riding bikes—that's enough, right?

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Ashikiba's expression eased slightly.

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: I was really worried...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: I thought you might have been kidnapped, since you trust people so easily...

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: Not really...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: A grown adult suddenly skipping school for days—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: And your home phone wasn't answering—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: I had to ask the teacher and only then found out you'd moved...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: And you didn't have a cell phone back then either—

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: Oh, I forgot my phone again today!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: What should we do? Do you remember your home phone number?

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: I don't remember, waaah—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: I'll contact Izumida later.

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: Please do, Junta!

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Ashikiba looked at me with teary eyes like he did when he was little. Thankfully, he didn't lunge at me like he used to back then...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Yeah, everyone was so worried!

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Ashikiba's head drooped even lower—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Everyone thought you were an alien!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Maybe you finally couldn't stand Earth anymore and went back to home planet!

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: Huh? Why would I?

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: You're always so out there, saying stuff no one understands—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: And you're taller than most people—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: That cowlick on your head looks like an alien signal receiver—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: That mole on your face is some kind of transformation switch or something—

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: Everyone's regretting not pressing it sooner!

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Ashikiba finally shook off his gloom and broke into a happy smile—

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: Hahaha~ That sounds so cool~

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Exactly!

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: Everyone's making such a big deal out of nothing.

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: It's just a regular mole.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Saying this, Ashikiba touched the heart-shaped mole on his right cheek—

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: Want to feel it, Junta?

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: As he spoke, Reedwood closed his eyes and leaned his face close to mine—

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: My heart pounding, I pressed down—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Did you feel anything special?

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: It tickles~

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Hahaha!

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: And... it feels so good~

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Ashikiba flashes a warm smile~

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: But I've known you were in the box club since last year.

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: I never imagined you'd make the starting lineup~

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: You really are talented!

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: Hehehe, all thanks to you~

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: At Hakugaku, that prestigious private cycling school, you must've endured a lot!

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: Hmm—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Let me guess... The hardest part for you must have been—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: As a prestigious private school with tradition, Hakogaku must have tons of rules—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Like not being allowed to grow your hair long?

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: If I go there, will they make me cut my hair short?

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: Your length is fine though~

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Hakogaku's training regimen is beyond what most people could endure...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: I accidentally got wind of Hakogaku's schedule earlier—it's terrifying—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Not only is the cycling workload three times that of Sohoku's—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: They also have tons of endurance and muscle-building drills!

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: Not everyone has to do all of them, though~

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: So you're all buff now, right, Aiba?

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Let me see!

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: Hahaha, that tickles—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Seems like most of Hakogaku are boarders, huh...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Can you even fit on that bed?

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: How'd you know? Half my foot hangs off the edge when I sleep...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Well, you are tall!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Finally getting to sleep at home again lately...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: That's great!

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: I patted Ashikiba on the shoulder—

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: Chatting with you was so much fun~

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Me too~ feels like going back to childhood.

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: You really haven't changed a bit~

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: You have changed so much, becoming even stronger than before—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Really? Hahaha~

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: And actually, I have changed...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: I meant your core hasn't changed at all—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: You still love complimenting people~

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: I'm just telling the truth—You're the best!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: I'll take that as a compliment~

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: My core isn't completely unchanged...

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: It's just that you're a bit slow on the uptake...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Who says I am?

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: And you're so popular now...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: What? I haven't noticed that at all!

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: If I don't make up with you soon, someone else will snatch you away!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: That won't happen, don't worry~

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: That's exactly why you're so slow on the uptake, Junta—

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: Don't worry, Junta. I'll definitely protect you!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Then I'll leave it to you~

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: My pleasure~

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Ashikiba is still the same old one, impossible to figure out what he's thinking...

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Maybe that's just his way of showing friendship~

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: Since we're not enemies anymore,

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: I can come hang out with you often, right?

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Don't you have to go to cram school?

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: I can go to a cram school in Chiba!

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: I have to get into the same university as you!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Seeing you so motivated puts my mind at ease~

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: It'd be great if we could go to the same university~

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Seeing how spirited Ashikaba looked, I couldn't help but smile.

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Oh right, I think I'm on duty today!

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: Junta, you go ahead. I'll wait for you at the bike club?

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Can you handle it alone?

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: Yes!

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Seeing Ashikiba nod—

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: While pondering how to apologize to Hirata later, I started running...

lines.speaker: Hirata
lines.text: Whew—finally finished cleaning!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Good thing it's not Friday—didn't take too long.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Hirata and I returned the cleaning supplies to the storage room.

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Are you heading home next?

lines.speaker: Hirata
lines.text: I'm going to the shopping district later—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: No wonder you're in such a hurry~

lines.speaker: Hirata
lines.text: Are you still going to practice riding later?

options.text: Go to the staffroom to turn in college application

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: I'm heading to the faculty room—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: I haven't submitted my application form yet...

lines.speaker: Hirata
lines.text: Oh, you haven't decided on a school yet?

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: How easy do you think it is to decide?

lines.speaker: Hirata
lines.text: Just go to a school with a cycling club~

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Haha, you're right~

lines.speaker: Hirata
lines.text: But it's good to really think it through~

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: You talk like you've already got a spot lined up?

lines.speaker: Hirata
lines.text: What I mean is—this is youth, right?

lines.speaker: Hirata
lines.text: Besides, shouldn't you be the one with the guaranteed spot?

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: But I didn't even place, haha!

lines.speaker: Hirata
lines.text: This is more like you, and it's actually pretty good~

lines.speaker: Hirata
lines.text: If you suddenly became a super successful person, a super elite,

lines.speaker: Hirata
lines.text: I wouldn't dare chat with you like this!

lines.speaker: Hirata
lines.text: The way you are now is much more reassuring~

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: So I should thank my ordinariness, huh?

lines.speaker: Hirata
lines.text: Anyway, keep pedaling hard, you bike nerd~

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: As I watched her receding figure, a sudden emptiness filled my heart—

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: These carefree moments of bickering with Hirada won't last much longer...

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: ...Everyone must head toward their own futures—

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: What about me?

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Perhaps the only thing I can be certain will never change is "keep riding my bicycle"...

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Perhaps the answer lies only on the road ahead, as I keep pedaling on—

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: And on that road, I'm sure I'll meet important people again—

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: This brings me a small sense of reassurance in my otherwise uncertain future.

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Ah—suddenly I really want to ride a bike!

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Let's head to the club room—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Alright, I'll head to the clubroom to ride my bike.

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: At this hour, I can still make a round trip—

lines.speaker: Hirata
lines.text: Good luck with that. I'm heading back~

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: After saying goodbye to Hirata, I hurried toward the cycling club.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Thinking about all the troubles ahead...

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: I just wanted to clear my mind and ride freely—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Ah—I really want to ride my bike!
Haha, look who's here—the bike-obsessed fool!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Huh? Manami—!!!

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: Hehehe~ It's me~

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: What are you doing here?

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: And how dare you call me an idiot!

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: None of that matters.

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: I just heard Kojima-senpai wanted to ride a bike, right?

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: I'm not Kojima—

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: Come on, come on, Senpai! Let's go for a couple laps~

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: It's Teshima, you idiot!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: And if I ride with you, how am I supposed to study tonight?!

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: You wouldn't have time to study today anyway, right?

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: Anyway, come on, come on!

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: I even brought the bike for you~

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Manami pointed to a spot not far away—

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Sure enough, parked in the grass was my Canon Dell, along with his white Look...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: How did you know where my bike was?

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: Manami hopped on her bike and kept urging me on.

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: Come on, come on~ Let's go~

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: This kid is seriously persistent!

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: I had no choice but to hop on my bike and follow him down the back ramp—

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: Sakamichi-kun told me ages ago that the slope behind Sohoku High is seriously tough!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Yeah, when we first enrolled, we couldn't even make it up...

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: Shima: How fast can you go up it now, Senpai?

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: About 7 minutes?

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Still slower than Onoda and the others though...

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: I'll give it a shot later too!

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Seeing his eager expression sent a chill down my spine—

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: There's really no studying tonight...

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: Even if you push yourself, you'll still keep pace with me.

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: Maybe we can both break six minutes~

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Saying this, Manami beamed and challenged me with her gaze—

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: I could only sigh helplessly.

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Yeah. After all, pushing myself is my signature move—

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: Hahaha, I love this special move of yours, Senpai~

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: We bickered all the way downhill, feeling the autumn breeze brush past our ears.

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: So far it's just been a warm-up.

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: I can't wait to start climbing~

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Seeing his restless excitement, I couldn't help but smile.

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: I've been fixated on the high school tournament.

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: But now I'm finally free of that mental burden!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: It's nice to have a relaxed race with you~

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Manami expressed strong dissatisfaction upon hearing this!

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: Teshima-senpai, you did that on purpose!

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: I still have a year left!

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: I chuckled. Finally got my chance.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Looks like even this kid has his limits!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Hahaha, heard you became captain!

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: Yeah, but Yuto, Doubashi, and Takadajo are always chasing me down. It's gotten way harder to sneak out for bike rides...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: But you're still sneaking out like usual!

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Manami sighed about how tough being captain really was, and I nodded in agreement.

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: Teshima-senpai, what do you think is the hardest part about being captain?

options.text: Be the strongest on the team
Write the club journal every day

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Probably the mental burden of carrying the responsibility to lead everyone to victory...

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: Yeah, I'm not very good at that...

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: It's rare to see Manami looking so downcast.

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Don't overthink it!

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: I hurried to comfort him.

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Haven't the Hakone runners always been strong individually?

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Just leave it to them—everyone will perform at their best!

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: You're right~

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Manami felt a little relieved...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Everyone probably thinks the captain has to be the strongest person on the team, right?

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Back then, I was constantly challenged by all sorts of people...

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Because I was weak, you see...

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Saying that, I felt a bit guilty—I'd already prepared a plan to let Koga be captain...

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Manami looked at me with pure smugness—

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: Does my high absence rate count?

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Hahaha~

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: In a way, you're already the best since you made it to third year!

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: Hehehe~

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: I'm not complimenting you!

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Manami looks really happy—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: For you, that is...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: It's probably like writing a diary every day?

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: Whoa—that's really, really tough, Senpai...

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Manami looked at me with teary eyes—seems I hit a nerve...

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: Who decided the club journal has to be written by the captain...

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: Now I'm constantly getting dragged off to copy the club yearbook...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Hahahahaha—

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: Can't Takada-jo and the others just be flexible and write it for me?!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: I used to stay late writing it too~ Those were the days~~~~~

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: Can I ask you for help if I get stuck writing it later?

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Manami blinked his big eyes and looked at me obediently—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Though there probably isn't much to reference, feel free to ask anytime~

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: That's great~

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Manami looked incredibly happy—

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: It seems Manami deeply understands the challenges of being captain.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: And—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Being captain of Hakogaku is even harder—

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: Why?

options.text: Carrying the weight of two years of losses

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Because you can't remember names—

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: Whoa! How did you know—

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: I feel like if he wasn't on his bike, Manami might have thrown hiself at me, leaving snot and tears all over me...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: After all... you can't even remember my name...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: With a cycling club as big as Hakogaku,

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: There must be at least twenty or thirty new members every year, right?

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: Nonsense!

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: How could I forget Teshima-senpai's name!

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Manami protests vehemently—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Then what is my name?

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: Um... well... that...

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: Jun-chan?

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Wrong—

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: Eh— Didn't Ashikiba-senpai always call me that?

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: That's only because Ashikiba still calls me that.

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: It's just a childhood nickname...

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Only Ashikiba still calls me like we did back then...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Anyway, this is really tough for you—

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: That's too mean! I was just joking~

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: How could I possibly forget Junta-senpai's name?

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: So you've been toying with me this whole time, huh?

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: Guess?

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Manami looked at me smugly—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Because everyone in the Hakogaku is so strong...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: It's hard to coordinate, right?

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: And—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: The hardest one to coordinate with is you yourself!

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: That's so mean! I'm super cooperative—basically.

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: If they tell me to climb, I climb!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Only when it comes to climbing, though...

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: Hehehe~

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: The pressure was immense after losing twice...

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: After thinking it over, I still couldn't bring myself to say it.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Even though it's the truth, it'd be too heavy for this sensitive boy standing before me.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: If it were me, I would've given up long ago...

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: That's probably why he's so much stronger than me?

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Whatever the outcome, I hope he can overcome it...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Nothing. We should've turned back earlier—

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: Got it—

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Manami and I pedaled toward the slope behind the mountain—

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: Senpai, you're going to keep cycling in college, right?

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Manami turned his head to look at me, wind ruffling his hair—

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Through the gaps in his hair, I caught a glimpse of Manami's smile.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Just like during the high school league back then—

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: I couldn't hold back.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Gritting my teeth, I sprinted ahead of Manami!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Yeah, I'm no great shakes, but I'm not ready to retire just yet—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Besides, cycling between study sessions is good exercise~

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: I glanced back and saw Manami nodding in agreement.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: With a casual little burst of speed, he was right beside me...

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: That's great! Can I ask you to train me too then?

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: As he spoke, he deliberately leaned his bike closer to mine—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Hey—don't come any closer!

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Manami stared at me with a defiant look.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: But I wasn't about to lose the battle of wills...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Don't underestimate exam prep students.

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: You'll see next year!

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: Go ahead, senpai.

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: I'll catch up to you soon enough~

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: His eyes lit up the moment cycling came up—who was it calling me a bike idiot?

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: I told you Teshima-senpai was a bike nerd—he just can't stop grinning when cycling comes up.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Huh?

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: How did another idiot beat me to the punch?

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Did I laugh?

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: Yes, you did~

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: And you're grinning like crazy too!

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: It's not just because of cycling~

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Then why?

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: Because today was so much fun! Getting to challenge the hill climb record with you, Teshima-senpai~

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Uh... Manami's gaze is giving me the creeps...

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Hope I don't get blown away and can't get back up...

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: Hehe, then please guide me, Senpai—I'm off~

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Whoosh—Manami instantly shot up the back hill of Sohoku!

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: I frantically stomped on the pedals to keep up—

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Manami and I engaged in an intense race

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: At least it felt that way to me, since I was already over 6 minutes in...

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Though thanks to him, it left me feeling a bit unsatisfied.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: But seeing how happy Manami looked, it felt kinda nice~

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Um... wanna go another lap?

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: I wasn't planning on studying tonight anyway—

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: While Senpai's invitation is certainly tempting, I have something more important to do—

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Manami wore a wry smile.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: I can't believe I got rejected by this hill-climbing maniac!

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: I'm shocked!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Oh right, aren't you supposed to be in school today?

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: What are you doing in Chiba?

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: I followed Ashikiba senpai here earlier.

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: He insisted on coming to find you—

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: ...said today was your birthday—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Ah!

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: So, Teshima-senpai, let's hurry to the cycling club!

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: Everyone's probably waiting for you~

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Manami practically dragged me along as he pulled me toward the cycling club—

lines.speaker: Everyone
lines.text: Happy Birthday, Teshima-senpai——————

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: You guys secretly planned a birthday party for me!

lines.speaker: Onoda
lines.text: Hehe, I've always been so grateful for your kindness, Senpai~

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Thank you all, I'm so touched~

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: Happy birthday, Junta!

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: Hehehe, I came along too~

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Not just Sohoku—how come everyone from Hakogaku is here too?

lines.speaker: Aoyagi
lines.text: Just us few might not be enough to handle Junta—

lines.speaker: Imaizumi
lines.text: If you find out, there won't be any surprise.

lines.speaker: Koga
lines.text: Honestly, just me would've been enough (glasses glare)—

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: So that's why you kept trying to stop me from coming to the clubroom, huh?

lines.speaker: Naruko
lines.text: Curly-haired Senpai, eat and have fun to your heart's content today!

lines.speaker: Kaburagi
lines.text: So much delicious food...Huh?

lines.speaker: Kaburagi
lines.text: Why are there so many takoyaki?

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Everyone's making such a racket—this is what makes Sohoku so lively~

lines.speaker: Onoda
lines.text: It hasn't been this lively since the high school tournament~

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Yeah, it's so much fun~

lines.speaker: Onoda
lines.text: Hehe~ If Senpai's happy, we've succeeded!

lines.speaker: Kaburagi
lines.text: Sorry to keep you waiting—now for a special segment!

lines.speaker: Naruko
lines.text: Ta-da! Truth or Dare—

lines.speaker: Naruko
lines.text: Whoever draws the King card gets to choose someone to play Truth or Dare~

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Naruko passed around a bamboo stick among everyone, finally coming to my side—

lines.speaker: Naruko
lines.text: Come on, curly-haired senpai, pick one~

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: I picked a bamboo stick, and saw the tip was red...

lines.speaker: Naruko
lines.text: Curly-haired Senpai is the King!

lines.speaker: Onoda
lines.text: Congratulations, Teshima-senpai~

lines.speaker: Kaburagi
lines.text: Senpai, pick a number quickly~

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: You guys are way too obvious, aren't you?

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Today is probably going to be one of those days where I cry my eyes out...

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: I guess I'll just have to bite the bullet—

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Junta—

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Aoyagi flushed and stood up. Looks like he got picked—

lines.speaker: Aoyagi
lines.text: Junta is the most important person to me—

lines.speaker: Naruko
lines.text: So he chose truth?

lines.speaker: Aoyagi
lines.text: Back then, I wasn't good at expressing myself.

lines.speaker: Aoyagi
lines.text: I always felt like I couldn't help much.

lines.speaker: Aoyagi
lines.text: Even though I was quiet and reserved, you never looked down on me.

lines.speaker: Aoyagi
lines.text: Junta always pulled me forward with him—

lines.speaker: Aoyagi
lines.text: I've always believed forming T2 with you is the greatest fortune of my life!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Aoyagi...

lines.speaker: Aoyagi
lines.text: That's why, whether now or in the future, I want to stay with you forever!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Aoyagi, I'm so happy you feel the same way~

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Aoyagi took my hand—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: T2 will never disband!

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Aoyagi flashed a dazzling smile—

lines.speaker: Aoyagi
lines.text: Yes, we'll always be T2—

lines.speaker: Aoyagi
lines.text: Though there's so much more I want to say—

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: His grip on my hand tightened, his gaze more resolute than ever.

lines.speaker: Aoyagi
lines.text: But Junta is just fine the way he is now~

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Hehe~

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Imaizumi shot to his feet, then just stood there...

lines.speaker: Naruko
lines.text: Say something! Truth or dare?

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: What's up? Don't want me to graduate?

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: So you want me to graduate quickly?

lines.speaker: Imaizumi
lines.text: No, no!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: See? Elites like you just look down on ordinary folks like me.

lines.speaker: Imaizumi
lines.text: Teshima-senpai, stop calling me an elite!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Hahahahaha—

lines.speaker: Imaizumi
lines.text: I've always respected you, Teshima-senpai.

lines.speaker: Imaizumi
lines.text: I've seen all the effort you put in...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Imaizumi... So you've been admiring this ordinary guy all along?

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Overcome with emotion, I wrapped my left arm around Imaizumi’s head.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: And ruffled his hair with my right~

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Next year depends on you—you're our team's ace!

lines.speaker: Imaizumi
lines.text: Yes, and also...

lines.speaker: Imaizumi
lines.text: Let go! I can't breathe—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Huh? You mean you're tall, right? So this is how you elites act?

lines.speaker: Imaizumi
lines.text: I said it's not that!

lines.speaker: Koga
lines.text: Nothing more to say to you.

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Huh?

lines.speaker: Koga
lines.text: Finally, I won't have to see someone as weak as you struggling desperately to keep up in front of me anymore!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: It's my birthday today, you know!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: At least say something nice!

lines.speaker: Koga
lines.text: Honestly, you're clearly weak, yet you always manage to catch up to me.

lines.speaker: Koga
lines.text: No matter how many times I drop you, you just grit your teeth and chase after me.

lines.speaker: Koga
lines.text: So honestly, you're a real pain in the ass—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: You sadistic glasses-wearer!

lines.speaker: Koga
lines.text: Hmph. I never planned on being your friend anyway.

lines.speaker: Koga
lines.text: But if you give up cycling just because you're too weak—

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: The most sarcastic person of all is suddenly the most earnest—

lines.speaker: Koga
lines.text: I'll chase you down to the ends of the earth and give you an earful!

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Koga locked my neck with arms as solid as a rugby player’s,

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: And the air felt thin in an instant…

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: I jabbed my elbow into his ribs in retaliation—

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: But it hardly made a difference…

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: I'll never quit before you do!

lines.speaker: Koga
lines.text: Persistence is your greatest strength~

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: You devilish glasses!

lines.speaker: Koga
lines.text: So you better keep riding your bike properly in college too—

lines.speaker: Koga
lines.text: Don't let me down~

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: This is infuriating!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: I'm gonna ride my bike like crazy and blow everyone away!

lines.speaker: Koga
lines.text: Hahahaha~

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: Sorry, Junta.

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: I never celebrated your birthday all these years...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: But I can make it up to you from now on!

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: Mm-hmm—

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: From now on, I'll celebrate every single birthday with you, Junta~

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Now all your future birthdays will have someone to celebrate them with~

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: How incredibly lucky~

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Also, next month is your birthday, right?

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: Mm-hmm

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Is there anything you'd like for a gift?

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: Junta~

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Say it?

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: The birthday present I want is you, Junta~

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Ashikiba picked me up like he did when I was little—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Fine, I'll spend the whole day with you then.

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Put me down first!

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: That's not what I meant...

lines.speaker: Ashikiba
lines.text: But it's so great to be able to play with Shun again!

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: It felt like childhood all over again~

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: But with Ashikiba's current build, if he keeps charging at me like he did back then...

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Better to dodge him next time!

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: Can I choose Truth or Dare?

lines.speaker: Naruko
lines.text: Finally, someone who knows the rules!

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: I know how to play—I saw it on TV~

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Manami probably doesn't have much to say either, right?

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Since our only connection is the high school tournament?

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Manami suddenly leaned in and planted a kiss on my cheek—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Waaah! What are you doing?!

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: Huh? Isn't that how Truth or Dare works?

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Absolutely not!

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: Then I'll choose Truth!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Just a token gesture is fine, no need to take it so seriously...

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: I like you, Teshima-senpai!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Huh? You don't have to play anymore! I know you can't play!

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: Even though it was just that one race, you showed me what true freedom really is—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: You sure are free!

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: So what's the next part?

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: Can I take you for a sneak run?

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: What kind of TV show are you watching?!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: We all know that's not how it's done!

lines.speaker: Naruko
lines.text: Number 5? We don't have a number 5, do we?

lines.speaker: Kaburagi
lines.text: Then the next round?

lines.speaker: Onoda
lines.text: How about Teshima-senpai goes?

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: The banquet was drawing to a close.

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Thank you all so much for these past years~

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: The days we rode bikes together—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: I'll never forget them for the rest of my life...

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: It might sound like a closing statement, but these are my true feelings...

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Sohoku is the best team ever!

lines.speaker: Everyone
lines.text: Oh—

lines.speaker: Kaburagi
lines.text: That's true!

lines.speaker: Kaburagi
lines.text: But why are the Hakogaku guys joining in with the "Oh!"?

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Despite all the noise and commotion, there's no denying some friction exists—

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: But that's just Souhoku's vibe, right?

lines.speaker: Manami
lines.text: So what's the next segment?

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: We're all cyclists here. What do you think?

lines.speaker: Naruko
lines.text: Let's go! All of us, out for a ride!

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: When we all get together, there's only one possible outcome~

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: The future remains uncertain.

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: But I believe none of us here will ever give up cycling~

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: As long as we keep riding, we'll always be connected—

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Because—

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: Riding a bike is just so damn fun—

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Come on!

lines.speaker: Teshima
lines.text: Let’s enjoy a ride together, guys!

lines.speaker: Everyone
lines.text: — Yeah!

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: (The End!)

lines.speaker: narrator
lines.text: ~Thanks for your attention~
